meanings.definition: The capacity of an atom to combine with a certain number of other atoms.
meanings.sent1: The valence of the atom determines how many other atoms it can bond with.
meanings.sent2: In chemistry, we study the valence of elements to understand their bonding behavior.
meanings.sent3: The valence of the atom was so high, it made all the other atoms jealous!
meanings.sent4: Her valence was like a magnet, attracting other atoms to form strong bonds.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the valence of atoms is crucial for predicting chemical reactions.

meanings.definition: The number of positive or negative charges of an ion.
meanings.sent1: The valence of the ion indicated its overall charge.
meanings.sent2: An ion's valence can be positive, negative, or neutral.
meanings.sent3: The ion's valence was so negative, it repelled all the positive charges around it!
meanings.sent4: His words carried a valence of positivity that uplifted everyone around him.
meanings.sent5: The valence of the ion determined its behavior in the chemical reaction.

meanings.definition: The degree of attractiveness or aversiveness of a situation or object.
meanings.sent1: The valence of the situation made it appealing to many people.
meanings.sent2: The valence of the object influenced people's preferences.
meanings.sent3: Despite its valence, the situation turned out to be quite enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: The valence of her smile brightened up the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The valence of the painting evoked strong emotions in the viewers.
